lead.p: match â€” Matches a string with a string or regular expression.

return.p: mixed: array or null if not matched.

example.heading: match example
example.p: There a multiple ways to pass in the expression.
example.code: console.log('Hello World'.match(RegExp('l'))); // ["l", index: 2, input: "Hello World"] console.log('Hello World'.match(new RegExp('l'))); // ["l", index: 2, input: "Hello World"] console.log('Hello World'.match(/l/)); // ["l", index: 2, input: "Hello World"] console.log('Hello World'.match('l')); // ["l", index: 2, input: "Hello World"]

example.heading: match example
